intro: Chelonopsis moschata, commonly known as the musk melon, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant produces large, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that develop into the edible fruit. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic flesh that is often used in culinary applications. It requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
